questions.question: Which of the following is not a valid access specifier in C++?
Which of the following is a feature of C++ that is not available in C?
What is the purpose of the 'virtual' keyword in C++?
options: To allow method overriding in derived classes.
To create a class with no instances.
questions.answer: To allow method overriding in derived classes.

questions.question: Which of the following operators cannot be overloaded in C++?
Which of the following statements about constructors in C++ is false?
options: A constructor cannot have a return type.
A constructor can be called explicitly.
questions.answer: A constructor can be called explicitly.

questions.question: What does the 'delete' operator do in C++?
options: Deallocates memory that was allocated with 'new'.
Removes an element from a container.
questions.answer: Deallocates memory that was allocated with 'new'.

questions.question: Which of the following is used to handle exceptions in C++?
Which of the following is true about 'static' variables in C++?
options: They retain their value between function calls.
They are initialized every time the function is called.
They are local to the function they are declared in.
They can be used only in classes.
questions.answer: They retain their value between function calls.

questions.question: Which of the following is not a valid way to initialize a C++ array?
What is the purpose of the 'const' keyword in C++?
